result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josephine R Alloway

defendant.name: Alloway, Josephine R
defendant.address: PO Box 111, 5361 Youngs Lane, Crandon, WI 54520

records.addlTxt:
9:16 AM Defendant Josephine R Alloway in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, asks why no attorney is present with her today. Alloway informs Court she has been very sick and has not had a chance to contact him. Court will allow one more adjournment and gives ramifications of appearing without, continues bond, sets for AIA on 11/9/22 at 9:15 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.

9:03 AM Defendant Josephine R Alloway in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Alloway has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Alloway states she will be hiring Mr. Kennedy, is putting down her first retainer payment today. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 10/5/22 at 9:30 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:45 AM . Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Josephine R Alloway in court. Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has not. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney; private hire, SPD or court appointed if not eligible for SPD. Defendant understands and will contact a private attorney. Court will continue bond and has set for AIA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Josephine R Alloway
Current: PO Box 111, 5361 Youngs Lane, Crandon, WI 54520   (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: PO Box 111 5361 Youngs Lane, Crandon, WI 54520
No consumption of alcohol. Not to enter casino.
